description: The UK and Norway will help fund the delivery of hundreds of thousands of drones to Ukraine, as European allies seek to put the war-torn nation in the best possible position amid faltering progress toward a ceasefire with its Russian invaders.
title: UK Funds Military Drones for Ukraine Amid Ceasefire Push

description: International Business Machines Corp. spent months revising its diversity initiatives as conservative attacks and souring attitudes toward DEI shifted into a full-blown assault from President Donald Trump.
title: IBM Informs Staff of DEI Retreat as Trump-Era Scrutiny Grows

description: President Donald Trump’s decision to oust the National Security Agency’s top two leaders was a concerning move that came with little public explanation, said Paul Nakasone, who led the powerful agency until retiring last year.
title: Former NSA Chief Voices Concern Over Successor’s Firing by Trump

description: The US Supreme Court said President Donald Trump’s administration must take steps to bring back a Maryland man who immigration officials conceded was wrongly deported to a notorious prison in his native El Salvador.
title: Supreme Court Tells US to Seek Wrongly Deported Man’s Return

description: President Donald Trump said he’s considering leveraging legal services donated by white-shoe law firms who brokered agreements to avoid punishment by the federal government to help negotiate trade deals.
title: Trump Floats Asking Top Law Firms to Do Trade Deal Work Pro Bono

description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent wasn’t directly involved in setting the steepest American tariff rates since before World War II. But he’s now in charge of negotiations to avoid them getting implemented.
title: Bessent Emerges as Wall Street Man-of-the-Hour Trade Negotiator

description: By the time word reached Beijing, it was too late to contain the damage.
title: Li Ka-shing’s Beijing Rift Threatens His Deal of a Lifetime

description: A federal district court judge rejected a request by immigration advocacy organizations to block a Trump administration rule requiring millions of immigrants to register with the federal government.
title: Judge Allows Trump to Move Ahead With Immigrant Registry Rule

description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Columbia University activist Mahmoud Khalil should be deported because his presence in the United States harms the country’s foreign policy interests even if his beliefs and statements are “otherwise lawful.”
title: Columbia Activist Can Be Deported for His Beliefs, Rubio Says

description: Wealthy Indonesians are shifting hundreds of millions of dollars offshore amid mounting concerns over President Prabowo Subianto’s fiscal discipline and the country’s economic stability.
title: Rich Indonesians Wary of Prabowo’s Policies Send Wealth Overseas

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior writer for economics Shawn Donnan surveys the impacts already being felt from tariffs. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Celebration of Trump’s Tariff Pause Turned Out to Be Premature

description: Mark Carney is promising tougher policies to curb illegal guns and drugs flowing into Canada from the US, including more police at the border.
title: Canada’s Carney Pledges Crackdown on Guns, Drugs Flowing From US

description: US Ambassador to Ukraine Bridget Brink is stepping down after three years as the top US representative in Kyiv, State Department spokeswoman Tammy Bruce said Thursday.
title: US Ambassador to Ukraine Is Stepping Down After Three Years

description: A passenger jet carrying at least two members of Congress was clipped by another commercial plane on the ground at Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport near Washington, DC.
title: Plane Carrying New York Lawmakers Is Clipped at Reagan Airport

description: The UK and France will accelerate the military planning of the “coalition of the willing” over the next two weeks to focus on ensuring the security of Ukraine’s air, sea and land as well as the regeneration of its forces, UK Defense Secretary John Healey and French Defense Minister Sébastien Lecornu told reporters.
title: UK and France to Accelerate Military Planning for Ukraine Force

description: TC Energy Corp. Chief Executive Francois Poirier ruled out selling the Canadian Mainline natural gas pipeline — which stretches across most of the country — as the trade war with the US pushes energy security up Canadian politicians’ priority list.
title: TC Energy Rules Out Mainline Sale as Canada Seeks Oil Security

description: President Donald Trump said he is looking to allow undocumented farm and hospitality industry workers to leave the US for a short period of time and reenter the country legally, a bid to address concerns about labor shortages from his crackdown on undocumented migration.
title: Trump Weighs Measures to Bring Farm Workers Back to US Legally

description: San Francisco Mayor Daniel Lurie said he will focus on tackling his city’s budget deficit, as the Trump administration’s trade war threatens to disrupt the global economy.
title: San Francisco Mayor Aims to Fix City Finances

description: Argentina renewed a portion of its $18 billion currency swap line with China just days before US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent visits the South American nation to meet President Javier Milei.
title: Argentina Renews Part of China Swap Ahead of Bessent Visit

description: The Dutch government seeks to loosen controversial rent control measures which critics say exacerbated the country’s housing crisis.
title: Netherlands Seeks to Soften Controversial Rental Controls, NOS Says

description: The Canadian government has invited representatives from US banks including JPMorgan Chase & Co. for a meeting, according to people with knowledge of the matter, after US President Donald Trump complained that American banks have trouble doing business in Canada.
title: Canadian Officials Said to Plan Meeting With US Banks After Trump Complaints

description: Ivy League universities including Harvard, Yale and Princeton are facing scrutiny from Republicans in Congress over how much they charge.
title: Ivy League Faces GOP Inquiry Into Potential Price Fixing

description: A federal judge denied President Donald Trump’s request to dismiss a lawsuit over comments he made last year about five men who were wrongly convicted in the 1989 jogger rape case and came to be known as the “Central Park Five.”
title: Trump Loses Bid to End ‘Central Park Five’ Defamation Lawsuit

description: Representative Jeff Van Drew said he thinks House Republicans will end up approving a $30,000 cap on the state and local tax deduction, a significant boost to the valuable and politically important write-off.
title: House Republican Sees SALT Deduction Limit Increasing to $30,000

description: Officials from the US and Iran are set to meet Saturday in Oman for the highest-level talks on the Islamic Republic’s advancing nuclear program in more than two years, a sign of Tehran’s eagerness for sanctions relief and to avoid the crippling military attack that President Donald Trump has threatened.
title: Years of Distrust Hang Over US and Iran as Their Negotiators Head to Oman

description: President Donald Trump’s escalating trade war with China once again increased tariffs applied to small parcels that were previously exempt from duties.
title: Trump Again Increases Small Parcel Tariff on China Shipments

description: OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman said he would not rule out helping the Pentagon develop a new weapons platform, the latest sign of a shift in how artificial intelligence companies think about working with the defense sector.
title: OpenAI’s Altman Won’t Rule Out Helping Pentagon on AI Weapons

description: The recent plunge in oil prices won’t be a game changer for Russia’s ability to finance its war machine as rising revenue from non-energy sectors and rainy-day reserves help offset losses.
title: Oil Price Slump Won’t Break Putin’s War Machine, For Now

description: Lisbon Mayor Carlos Moedas said the private sector can play an important role in increasing the supply of affordable housing in the Portuguese capital, where home prices have surged in recent years.
title: Lisbon Mayor Wants Companies to Help Fix City’s Housing Shortage

description: A Tanzanian court on Thursday charged opposition leader Tundu Lissu with treason, which carries the maximum penalty of death, as tensions mount in the East African nation before October elections.
title: Tanzanian Court Charges Opposition Leader Lissu With Treason

description: United States Steel Corp. shares posted their biggest drop in two months, a day after US President Donald Trump reiterated his long-held position that he doesn’t want to see the steelmaker owned by a Japanese company.
title: US Steel Falls 10% After Trump Says He Doesn’t Want Japan Owner

description: President Donald Trump’s drive to enact trillions of dollars in tax cuts and raise the federal debt is on track after he and congressional leaders successfully corralled House Republican lawmakers to approve a Senate-passed budget outline.
title: House Passes Plan to Advance Trump Tax Cuts, Debt Limit Boost

description: The proceeds of looted and smuggled gum arabic and gold helped the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces in Sudan sustain access to sophisticated weapons in its fight against Sudan’s army during the country’s brutal two-year civil war, according to an unpublished report by UN investigators.
title: UN Experts Say Looted Gum Arabic, Gold Fueling Sudan’s Civil War

description: The UK will be no better off after President Donald Trump’s surprise tariffs pause because its competitive advantage over other countries disappears and Washington’s volatile policy making will deter investment, economists said.
title: UK Won’t Benefit From Trump Tariff Climbdown, Economists Say

description: Nigeria expects to exit a global dirty-money watchlist this year after passing a new investment law that will allow regulation of cryptocurrencies, the chief of its financial regulator said.
title: Nigeria Optimistic of Exiting Dirty-Money Watchlist This Year

description: President Donald Trump said that he plans to withhold all federal funding to sanctuary cities, a move that would pressure finances from New York to San Francisco.
title: Trump Threatens to Cut Federal Funding to Sanctuary Cities

description: Canadian travelers are keeping their distance from the US, a country that was once their top destination, as tensions between the two nations grow.
title: Canadian Car Trips to US Plunge 32% as Trump Threats Strain Ties

description: Evidence of the plan is in plain sight, with Israel now controlling more of the enclave than at any point during the war
title: Israel’s Advance Into Gaza Lays Ground for Full-Scale Occupation

description: America’s trading partners around the globe reacted with a mixture of relief and bewilderment to President Donald Trump’s eleventh-hour decision to pause some of his most aggressive tariffs.
title: US Allies Greet Trump’s Tariff U-Turn With Relief, and Defiance

description: UK Chief of the Defence Staff Tony Radakin traveled to China this week for discussions with the country’s military, the first such visit by the UK’s most senior military official in a decade.
title: UK Sends Top Defense Chief to China for First Time in Decade

description: White House National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said that trade talks with some US counterparts are already well along, including deals that were close to done last week.
title: Hassett Says US ‘Well Advanced’ in Trade Talks, 15 Offers on Table

description: Norway’s Finance Ministry has decided to remove small companies in emerging markets from its benchmark index for stocks, allowing the $1.7 trillion sovereign wealth fund to focus its holdings of the 1.5% of all listed stocks.
title: Norway to Cut Small Emerging Market Stocks from Wealth Fund

description: South Africa is considering offering additional incentives to boost car production, as it weighs measures to offset the impact of US President Donald Trump’s trade war, said Trade, Industry and Competition Minister Parks Tau.
title: South Africa Weighs Auto Industry Incentives as Tariff Shield

description: The last six months have given the US climate tech sector an extreme case of whiplash, yet venture funding to the industry is on the rise.
title: How Climate Tech Investing Is Being Shaped by Trump’s Tariffs and Orders

description: Trump’s tariffs upend a nearly century-old bargain between politicians and US consumers.
title: Cheap Consumer Goods Are the American Dream, Actually

description: A low-profile hedge fund executive who’s among the dozens of disciples tracing their roots to the late investing legend Julian Robertson is poised to become the face of the Trump administration’s sanctions strategy.
title: Hedge Fund Veteran Set to Lead Trump’s Sanctions Strategy

description: Estonia’s parliament passed a law forcing the local affiliate of the Russian Orthodox Church to sever ties with its pro-Kremlin leadership in Moscow, in an escalating standoff with an institution widely seen as an instrument of Russian soft power.
title: Estonia Passes Law Banning Orthodox Church Ties to Moscow Clergy

description: China announced it would curb imports of Hollywood films, opening a new front in its trade war with the US hours after President Donald Trump’s record tariffs took effect.
title: China Limits Hollywood Films as Trade War Escalates to Services

description: The European Union will delay for 90 days the implementation of its counter tariffs against the US over the 25% duties President Donald Trump imposed on the bloc’s steel and aluminum exports last month.
title: EU Will Pause Metals Counter Tariffs Against US for 90 Days

description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal said any minerals agreement with the US can’t hurt his country’s aspirations to join the European Union as Kyiv dispatches a team to Washington for talks this week.
title: Shmyhal Says US Minerals Deal Can’t Hurt Ukraine’s EU Goals

description: The International Court of Justice began hearing Sudan’s case of complicity in genocide against the United Arab Emirates for its alleged involvement in the North African country’s brutal civil war, the world’s worst humanitarian crisis.
title: Sudan Takes UAE to International Court Over Genocide Accusation

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Trump Sets Collision Course With Xi as Tariff War Peaks

description: China hit back at Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy after he said Kyiv’s intelligence services identified at least 155 Chinese nationals fighting alongside Moscow’s troops, escalating a dispute over the issue.
title: China Condemns Zelenskiy for Saying More of Its People Fighting

description: Iran will consider expelling international nuclear inspectors and transferring its stocks of enriched uranium to secret locations if foreign military threats continue, a top aide to Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said.
title: Iran Warns It May Expel UN Nuclear Inspectors If Threats Persist

description: The German economy won’t see meaningful growth this year and Donald Trump’s tariff policies threaten an even bleaker outcome, according to the country’s leading research institutes.
title: German Institutes Slash 2025 Outlook and Warn of Tariff Pain

description: Several European nations and the United States have raised concern about the continued detention of South Sudan’s First Vice President Riek Machar and other high ranking opposition officials, and asked authorities to release them to facilitate negotiations.
title: US, EU Urge South Sudan to Free Vice President, Resume Talks

description: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss how the Republican president’s global tariff fight may do long-term harm to the US economy.
title: Will Donald Trump’s Tariff War Permanently Damage America?

description: US President Donald Trump may have announced a delay in some of his tariff plans, but the first signs of an economically-damaging slowdown in global trade are already emerging as companies around the world hit their own pause button on orders and he continues to escalate his trade war with China.
title: Trump Is Already Slowing Global Trade as Companies Pause Orders

description: Russia and the US on Thursday started a new round of talks aimed at normalizing diplomatic relations in Turkey’s Istanbul, even amid a lack of apparent progress in separate negotiations on ending the invasion of Ukraine.
title: Russia, US Hold Fresh Round of Talks in Turkey on Restoring Ties

description: A sanctioned ex-Russian governor of a city in Crimea was found guilty of flouting the financial restrictions by a London jury, becoming the first person criminally convicted for breaching the UK’s Russia sanction regime.
title: Ex-Russian Governor Found Guilty of UK Sanctions Violation

description: European Union digital chief Henna Virkkunen said the bloc’s rules governing digital platforms like X and Meta Platforms Inc. should not be considered barriers to trade with the US.
title: EU’s Digital Chief Says Bloc’s Tech Rules Are Not Trade Barriers

description: Thailand’s tariff talks with the Trump administration will factor in the impact of the high taxes slapped on China as local producers fret over the risk of an increase in the influx of cheap imports from the Asian neighbor, according to officials.
title: Thailand Says US Tariff Talks to Factor in High Chinese Levy

description: New Zealand’s parliament has rejected legislation that sought to define the principles of the Treaty of Waitangi, the 1840 agreement between indigenous Māori and the British Crown that is considered the nation’s founding document.
title: New Zealand Parliament Rejects Bill That Stirred Racial Tensions

description: President Donald Trump’s dramatic U-turn on tariff threats has isolated China as the primary target of his trade offensive, significantly narrowing Beijing’s options for immediate deescalation.
title: Trump Isolates China With Tariff Pivot, Setting Up Xi Showdown

description: Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said the US decision to pause a round of global tariffs can serve as a way to open “a door to negotiation” and therefore could lead to an agreement.
title: Spanish PM Sanchez Says US Tariff Pause Opens Door to Bargaining

description: For the man poised to become Germany’s next finance minister, Sept. 11, 2001 is a pivotal moment that will shape his thinking as he rebuilds the country’s defenses.
title: Germany’s Next Finance Minister Is Defense Expert Shaped by 9/11

description: African countries have watched with mounting angst as President Donald Trump has taken a hatchet to foreign aid and slapped tariffs on some of the world’s poorest nations. Now they’re concerned that US military cooperation that’s aided the fight against terrorists and rebellions may be next.
title: Trump Aid Cuts Stir Fears of Reduced Military Support in Africa

description: Albanian Prime Minister Edi Rama hailed Donald Trump as “good for everyone,” portraying the president’s abrasive treatment of US allies as an opportunity for a European Union that has lost its way to rediscover its mojo and build its global influence.
title: Trump World Plays Outsized Role in Albania’s Looming Election

description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te said his government could eliminate duties on US products if Washington did the same, the latest overture from the self-run democracy as it seeks to placate its main military backer.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Floats Zero Tariffs on US Goods to Placate Trump

description: An appeals court in Thailand granted bail to a US academic accused of insulting the country’s monarchy, a day after his arrest drew condemnation from Washington and civil rights groups.
title: US Academic Held in Thailand for Alleged Royal Insult Gets Bail

description: China’s top leaders are poised to meet Thursday to discuss additional economic stimulus after US President Donald Trump ratcheted up tariffs, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Top China Leaders to Meet on Stimulus After Trump’s Tariff Shock

description: Officials across Asia reacted to US President Donald Trump’s 90-day pause on higher tariffs for dozens of trade partners with a mixture of relief, caution and a little mockery.
title: Wary Asian Officials Seek to Ensure Trump Tariff Reprieve Sticks

description: The Association of Southeast Asian Nations will discuss on Thursday what they can do as a group to respond to President Donald Trump’s tariffs, according to officials.
title: Asean Ministers to Discuss Response to Trump Tariffs on Thursday

description: Christmas, and a lot else, will be more expensive this year for American consumers.
title: Walmart’s Missing Prices Show Trade Chaos Coming for Consumers

description: Vietnam Deputy Prime Minister Ho Duc Phoc met with US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer in Washington and agreed to start negotiations on a “reciprocal” trade agreement, according to a post on the government website.
title: Vietnam, US Agree to Start Negotiations on Trade Agreement

description: Japan will continue to urge US President Donald Trump to review his tariff measures in hopes of winning a reprieve following the president’s abrupt decision to put a hold on some of the reciprocal tariffs, according to Ryosei Akazawa, the nation’s top trade representative.
title: Japan to Keep Pressing for Tariff Relief During 90-Day Pause

description: The White House told US government agencies to expedite efforts to repeal regulations that officials deem “unlawful,” and skip the standard rulemaking process to do so in some instances.
title: Trump Administration Tells Agencies to Quickly Repeal ‘Unlawful’ Rules

description: New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon is proposing the formation of a rules-based trading bloc in response to sweeping US tariffs that threaten to hurt economies reliant on global trade.
title: New Zealand Proposes Rules-Based Trading Bloc to Counter Tariffs

description: A Republican drive to quickly pass President Donald Trump’s tax cut proposals and increase the US debt ceiling has been at least temporarily delayed by party infighting over federal deficits.
title: House Delays Vote on Tax-Cut, Debt Limit Plan Amid Deficit Spat
